titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Reformed Dutch Church of East Williamsburg Sunday School minute book 1973.299
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:16:05 +0000.

did.unittitle: Reformed Dutch Church of East Williamsburg Sunday School minute book
did.abstract: Minute book of the Reformed Dutch Church of East Williamsburg Sunday School, dated 1856 to 1902. The minutes document meetings of the Sunday School's teachers, and topics of discussion primarily concerned fiscal matters and issues regarding curriculum and instruction in the school.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Reformed Dutch Church of East Williamsburg was established in 1856 and was located on Flushing Avenue in the Brooklyn neighborhood of East Williamsburg.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Minute book of the Reformed Dutch Church of East Williamsburg Sunday School, dated 1856 to 1902. The minutes document meetings of the Sunday School's teachers, and topics of discussion primarily concerned fiscal matters and issues regarding curriculum and instruction in the school.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Reformed Dutch Church of East Williamsburg Sunday School minute book, Call or Accession number, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
